      Initializes most basic version of Blackjack with all default parameters.

    • Blackjack

      public Blackjack(int reshuffleCutOff)
      Initializes basic version of Blackjack with n players.
      Parameters:
      reshuffleCutOff - the amount of cards in the deck before which the game will reshuffle.

    • Blackjack

      public Blackjack(int reshuffleCut, int players, int decks, boolean highLow, boolean interactive, boolean npcAI, boolean advancedAI, boolean debugger, boolean simulation)
      Initializes advanced version of Blackjack with n players, m decks, and with optional highLow settings.
      Parameters:
      reshuffleCut - the amount of cards in the deck before which the game will reshuffle.
      players - the amount of players.
      decks - the amount of decks to play with.
      highLow - optional high-low ace setting.
      debugger - enables debugger output.

  • Method Details

    • deckCreator

      public void deckCreator()
      Creates deck based on parameters defined by game initialization.

      Specifically creates an instance n = deckCount instances of the deck class before adding these to the multideck created at the beginning of the program then shuffles.

    • singleGame

      public HashMap<String,Object> singleGame()
      Runs a single instance of the game and returns a Hashmap containing various game stats.

      Deals a public card to each player and then deals hole card to dealer (private card). Then creates decision matrix to store decisions from each hand. Will continue to deal as long as decisionMatrix contains true, will only deal to hands that state true.

      Returns:
      a HashMap containing various game stats tied to string names.

    • getGameState

      public ArrayList<Object> getGameState()
      Packages string representation of gameState along with game data into list and passes list out.

      String contains each hand and its current value, later determines winner and appends string corresponding to who has won.

      HashMap contains various game data values:

      "winState" : whether game was win, loss, or tie.

      "winners" : list of winners.

      "hands" : list of all hands.

      "winners.forEach((hand) -> hand.handName)" : hand of each Winner.

      Returns:
      list containing string representation of gameState in index 0 and HashMap of game Data in index 1.

    • getCardDecision

      public void getCardDecision(Scanner scanner, String decision, Hand hand, boolean doneFlag)
      When interactiveGame == true, this method is called to determine user input.

      Basic implementation of scanner to determine userInput. Some user input validation.

      Parameters:
      scanner - scanner object to use for user input.
      decision - decision string to set with scanner.
      hand - hand to determine choice for.
      doneFlag - whether to continue attempting to get user input.

    • fetchAll

      public static ArrayList<Card> fetchAll()
      fetchAll function parameterless, basically default to only get public cards when called without parameter.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of cards containing the public cards held by all hands.

    • fetchAll

      public static ArrayList<Card> fetchAll(boolean privateState)
      fetchAll function base version. Takes a boolean of whether to fetch all cards or just public cards from each hand.
      Parameters:
      privateState - whether to get private cards in addition to public cards/
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of cards containing public or all cards held in each hand.

    • visible

      public static ArrayList<Card> visible(Hand hand)
      Function that returns all cards possibly visible to any player.

      This function calls fetchAll(privateState:false) and then adds the hand that called the functions private list. As such all the information available to the player is contained here.

      Parameters:
      hand - the hand calling the function, will only add this hands private cards.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of visible cards.

    • decisionMaker

      public boolean decisionMaker(Hand hand)
      Calls AI corresponding to advancedAIState.
      Parameters:
      hand - hand to call with AI function.
      Returns:
      boolean value returned by corresponding AI function.

    • simpleAI

      public boolean simpleAI(Hand hand)
      Simple AI function that determines hand choice based on only value of hand and whether hand is "hard" or "soft".

      Basic Implementation of soft hands and hard hands. If hand contains ace that can count as either 1 or 11 then the hand is soft and risk tolerance is increased. On the other hand if hand contains no such ace hand is hard and lower risk tolerated.

      Parameters:
      hand - hand to calculate choice for.
      Returns:
      the decision reached by the AI based on hand state.

    • dealerAI

      public boolean dealerAI(Hand hand)
      Basic dealerAI function that determines choice for dealer based on game rules.

      Hits if below 17, stays if greater than or equal to 17.

      I commented out the part implementing the AI when the card value is over 17, so it just stays after 17.

      Parameters:
      hand - dealer hand to calculate choice for.
      Returns:
      decision reached by AI for dealer hand.

    • advancedAI

      public boolean advancedAI(Hand hand)
      advancedAI method no extra training parameter, just calls base advancedAI method.
      Parameters:
      hand - hand to determine choice for.
      Returns:
      decision reached by AI.

    • advancedAI

      public ArrayList<Object> advancedAI(Hand hand, boolean training)
      advancedAI method that implements Omega-II card counting algorithm to determine hand choice.

      Omega-II is a balanced algorithm meaning that the after counting every card in the deck the true count will be zero. Effectively the algorithm gets all the cards visible and seen by the player and for each of these cards a value of either -2, -1, 0, 1, or 2 is added to the running count. The running count is then divided by the amount of decks remaining to determine true count. Decks remaining is determined by dividing remaining cards by 52. This value and the current hand value are both sent to a linear function which determines the betModifier, which, if less than 0.5, will make the decision false.

      Interestingly enough this AI is pretty lackluster in outcome. The win rate is roughly equivalent to the expected win rate reached by playing perfect basic strategy (~38.9% (at 1,000,000 games)~ vs 42.2%). Lower than what would be expected by counting cards. For this reason I began to implement the machineLearningAI but ran out of time.

      Parameters:
      hand - hand to determine decision for.
      training - whether to output training data (not implemented).
      Returns:
      decision based on betModifier in AI.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      main function which uses userInput to create Blackjack instance corresponding to inputs.

      Determines player count, deck count, high-low ace state, interactive state, npcAI state, npcAI level, and debugInfo state. Then instantiates game.

      Parameters:
      args - just arguments genuinely does nothing.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the game by emptying all hand internal lists and if deck size less than reshuffleCutOff creates new deck.

      Should reset the game. Both the player Hand and dealer Hand should start with no cards. If the number of cards in the deck is less than the reshuffle cutoff, then the method should create a fresh (complete), shuffled deck. Otherwise, it should not modify the deck, just clear the player and dealer hands.

    • deal

      public void deal()
      Should deal out two cards to both players from the Deck.

    • playerTurn

      public boolean playerTurn()
      Have the player draw cards until the total value of the player's hand is equal to or above 16.
      Returns:
      false if the player goes over 21, (bust)

    • playerTurn

      public boolean playerTurn(Hand player)
      Have the player draw cards until the total value of the player's hand is equal to or above 16.
      Parameters:
      player - which player to deal to.
      Returns:
      false if the player goes over 21, (bust)

    • dealerTurn

      public boolean dealerTurn()
      Have the dealer draw cards until the total of the dealer's hand is equal to or above 17.
      Returns:
      false if the dealer goes over 21.

    • setReshuffleCutoff

      public void setReshuffleCutoff(int cutoff)
      Should assign the new cutoff value to the internal reshuffle cutoff field.
      Parameters:
      cutoff - the number of cards at which to reshuffle;

    • getReshuffleCutoff

      public int getReshuffleCutoff()
      Returns the current value of the reshuffle cutoff field.
      Returns:
      the reshuffleCutOff, the number of cards in the deck before the deck reshuffles on next Game.
